channel.title: Discovery Now
channel.description: Discovery Now is a daily 90 second program that presents an overview of aeronautics and astronautics technology, science, history, innovations, research, and inventions from the aerospace industry, worldwide.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Discovery Now presents an overview of aeronautics and astronautics technology, science, history, innovations, research, and inventions from the aerospace industry, worldwide.
channel.itunes:summary: Discovery Now is a daily 90 second program that presents an overview of aeronautics and astronautics technology, science, history, innovations, research, and inventions from the aerospace industry, worldwide.
channel.itunes:keywords: Hampton Roads, WHRO, WHRV, Norfolk, aeronautics and astronautics technology, science, history, innovations, research, inventions
channel.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Final Discovery Now
item.description: This is our final Discovery Now podcast. Please look for our new podcasts under the name 'Innovation Now'
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: NASA's Take on 2012
item.description: December 21, 2012. It's the last date on the Mayan calendar and the cataclysmic storyline of a Hollywood blockbuster. Now NASA weighs in on what threatens to set this day apart from any other.
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Asteroid Threats
item.description: In two decades, a very large, fast and destructive asteroid is headed towards our planet ; so who's keeping an eye on these space rocks anyway?
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Space Resort
item.description: Well-heeled travelers will soon have the chance to get their feet far off the ground in accommodations that are out of this world!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Earth is Leaking
item.description: Is Earth's atmosphere leaking out into the solar system?
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Einstein's Theories Tested
item.description: A race in space tests Einstein's theories of relativity
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Technologies Toll on the Brain
item.description: Between computers, cell phones, and the good old-fashioned boob tube, is technology taking a toll on some basic functions of the brain?
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: To Be Clean in Space
item.description: Cleanliness may be next to Godliness, but on a spacecraft it's a matter of life, death and accurate scientific research!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Keeping Up the Communication
item.description: Over forty years ago David Bowie's Major Tom lost communication with Earth while in space. Now the European Space Agency may have found a way to keep fiction from ever becoming fact!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Galactic Neigbors
item.description: A hundred and twenty-five years ago, a cosmic misfit was unveiled as one of our closest galactic neighbors. Now, new images reveal that this glowing beauty is filled with stellar pyrotechnics and splendor!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: More to the Equator
item.description: The equator divides the earth equally, north and south. But is it just an imaginary line? Or is this a middle that makes a muddle of our planet's climate?
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Airplane Sensors of the Future
item.description: When it comes to aircraft safety, minor dents, dings and cracks can be major. Now science is putting its energy towards early damage detection!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Extraterrestrial Minerals
item.description: They say that diamonds are a girl's best friend , but while we may live in a material world, the wealth of our planet's precious metals could have extraterrestrial origins!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: The Chemistry of Life
item.description: Science has yet to discover life on other planets, but the chemistry for life? Well, that's a whole new ball of gas.
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: A Ring Around Saturn
item.description: When it comes to giant rings, diamonds may be a girl's best friend, but they ain't got nothin' on a certain planet in our solar system!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Going Back to Venus
item.description: They've been out of touch for almost three decades, but now Russia is planning a reunion with Venus and inviting the international community to come along!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Mysterious Magnetic Fields
item.description: Unraveling the mysteries of magnetic fields requires a closer look at plasma.
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Moondust and Microwaves
item.description: NASA has another trick up its sleeve, but there's no magic hat - just moondust and microwaves!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: A New Type of Messaging
item.description: Ones and zero's of the digital world unite! Quantum messaging is right around the corner.
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Buttering Up Pilots
item.description: If you're training for a triathlon, watching your fat intake is a good idea. But if you're piloting a fighter jet, recent findings say, - bring on the butter!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: New Screening Possibilities
item.description: Remember when you could keep your clothes on at the airport? Those days may not be gone for good - if a new screening program proves successful.
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: ArterioVision Technology
item.description: Technology that helped us get a good look at Mars is now helping save lives here on Earth!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Fall of the Maya
item.description: The Mayan civilization was a dominant force in Central America for 1200 years. Then one day, they were gone. Now, NASA technology is helping to find out why.
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Insect Robots
item.description: New research out of Oxford is generating quite a buzz - and it all centers around an insect!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: Space Storms
item.description: The weather report for outer space is calling for continued cosmic ray storms and the most intense action may be yet to come!
item.itunes:author: 89.5 WHRV-FM, Norfolk, VA

item.title: New Way to Commute?
item.description: Hold on to your coffee cup, the future of mass transit is here - and your morning commute will never be the same!

item.title: Wimpy Dark Matter
item.description: Theories abound when it comes to Dark Matter. Some are popular one is just wimpy.

item.title: Haughton-Mars Project
item.description: NASA is set on studying distant planets. But before blasting off, they'll spend some time navigating the next best thing - right here earth.

item.title: Cliff Scaling Robot
item.description: With tips from cliff-scaling earthlings,teams of tethered rovers will really go places on Mars.
